sub_title: Director Sie Psychology Clinic - Sie Care
summary: More than 25 years experience in managing large programmes involving business process harmonisation, IT solution standardisation, and business change management in the oil-, and gas industry. Major expertise is in managing large programmes in the areas of IT, hydrocarbon accounting, and greenhouse gasses. In the last couple of years responsible for acting as managing Sie Psychology Clinic, and acting as chair for Health Center De Entree. On a personal level, Eric has a passion to work with, coach, and learn from diverse people across the globe, and organisations. He enjoys family trips into the mountains with his wife, and 2 children, and has a passion for music, skiing, and tennis.

education.field_of_study: International Business, Trade, and Tax Law

profile_positions.description: Sie Psychology Clinic provides mental healthcare in Alkmaar and Bergen, The Netherlands. Therapeutic treatments are designed to meet the specific needs of each individual client. The practice uses Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT),  EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing), ACT, and other techniques. Treatment, advice and/or diagnosis is done through face to face consultations and e-health. Our psychologists, and psychotherapists are committed and driven professionals. Together we offer a wide and modern range of assistance. We use effective treatment methods that have proven their worth according to scientific research. To be able to guarantee and justify quality within our care, we continuously work on quality improvement through: Intervision (peer review), supervision, further training, re-registration obligation (BIG professions), multidisciplinary consultation, yearly audit of our quality registers. Sie Psychology Clinic is an integral part of HealthCenter De Entree
profile_positions.title: Director Sie Psychology Clinic

profile_positions.description:
Accountable for the strategic delivery of a new global environmental reporting solution (SERS Programme) using  SAP EC, and SAP BW across Shell to Downstream Manufacturing, Upstream, and Projects & technology. 

Key achievements: 1. Design, and deployment of a global environmental reporting solution using SAP EC, and SAP BW across Downstream, and Upstream. 2. Improvement of accuracy of CO2 equivalent measurements, and reporting (in this case preventing over reporting of greenhouse gasses).
profile_positions.title: Program Manager - Global Environmental Reporting

profile_positions.description:
As leader responsible for the global  process harmonisation, business analysis, solution standardisation, and design for hydrocarbon revenue accounting for Shell Upstream. Prelude LNG being the 1st pathfinder.

Key achievements: 1. Setting the direction for the revenue accounting business strategy. 2. IT solution design for the new global revenue accounting process for Upstream.
profile_positions.title: Design Leader - Shell Upstream Revenue Accounting Solution

profile_positions.description:
Program manager, and leader for the global hydrocarbon accounting next generation programme, which covered: 1. Business Strategy. 2. Business case. 3. Solution Selection. 4. Global hydrocarbon allocation process lean out for Operated, Unconventionals, and Integrated Gas. 4. The related blueprint upgrade. 5. Deployments to all Operating Units. Budget involved USD 30 M with approx. 30 FTE.

Key achievements: 1. Business case for a new group investment proposal 2. Agreed strategy for way forward 3. Replacement of the legacy solution with the latest release of Energy Components.
profile_positions.title: Next Generation Hydrocarbon Accounting Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Business leader, and program manager, responsible for the process lean out of the hydrocarbon allocation and revenue accounting processes, and deployment of Energy Components (EC) across the US and Canadian production assets. Main purpose was to improve the accuracy of the production, deferment, and revenue related data, and realizing integration with the wells, reservoir, and facility management related initiatives. Budget was USD 48 M, involving approx 48 FTE.

Key achievements: 1. Successfully deployed both the US, and Canada with a hydrocarbon accounting solution. 2. Harmonized the US, and Canada hydrocarbon accounting processes with the standards globally. 3. Replaced hundreds of spreadsheets, and a multitude of systems. 4. Prevented further potential business control incidents. 5. Improved deferment
profile_positions.title: ePASS hydrocarbon accounting program manager

profile_positions.description:
As Program Manager, and leader responsible for the business case, process lean out, global design, and blueprint implementation for the global implementation (spanning the Upstream, and Midstream OUs globally) of Energy Components (EC) to realise a common global EP hydrocarbon production information management system. EC is a suite of software modules (Production, Transport, Sales, Revenue) for hydrocarbon production data acquisition, monitoring, reporting, allocation, and revenue accounting, covering the hydrocarbon value chain from reservoir to point of sale. It involved USD 75 M, and approx. 50 FTE.

Key achievements: 1. Improved deferment leading to substantial yearly cost reduction. 2. Leading a geographically, and culturally dispersed team of 50 FTEs. 3. Realised global hydrocarbon accounting process harmonisation. 4. Global Energy Components solution standardisation. 5. Global IT, and business support organisations.
profile_positions.title: Global EC hydrocarbon accounting program manager

profile_positions.description:
Highlights: Project manager for a variety of global projects: 1. Chemicals Customer Lounge (B2B Downstream), 2. Shell Global Credit Card, 3. HR IT Support Model.

Key achievements: 1. Simplified selling of chemicals.2. Significantly reduced travel costs within Shell globally. 3. Reduced HR support costs thru centralisation, and offshoring.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Development manager, and subsequently project manager for Shell's global IT services management solution (ITIL standards). This included the design, and development of application suite of products for incident management, change management, configuration management, service level management, event management, and knowledge management.

Key achievements: 1. Development of an IT services management application for Shell globally. 2. Roll-out of a services management solution in Europe. 3. Reporting standardisation across Shell globally. 4. Consolidation to regional helpdesk, whilst removing close to a hundred helpdesks.
profile_positions.title: Development Manager Services Management Solution

profile_positions.description:
Highlights: Managed material requirements planning for IBM's service parts in Europe, Africa, and Asia.

Achievements: Leaning out the materials management process, and keeping stock levels of parts to a minimum.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst - Logistics
